content:
That's fantastic! Data visualization and statistical modeling are both essential skills in today's data-driven world. Being able to present complex data in a clear and concise way can make a huge difference in how your findings are received and understood by your audience.

Tools like Tableau and Power BI are excellent for data visualization, and they can help you create interactive and dynamic dashboards that can be easily shared with others. I'm sure you'll find them very useful in your work.

It's great that you're thinking about sharing your new skills with others! Leading a training session or brown-bag lunch is a wonderful way to give back to your team and help them improve their skills. It's also a great opportunity for you to practice your public speaking skills in a more formal setting, as you mentioned.

By sharing your knowledge, you'll not only be helping your team, but you'll also be demonstrating your expertise and leadership skills. It's a win-win situation!

Remember to start small and focus on a specific topic or skill that you're comfortable with. You can start with a small group or one-on-one sessions and gradually scale up as you become more comfortable. Don't forget to get feedback from your team members and adjust your approach accordingly.

How do you plan to structure your training session or brown-bag lunch? Will you be creating a presentation, providing hands-on training, or leading a discussion?

Also, have you thought about creating a knowledge-sharing platform or community within your organization to encourage others to share their skills and expertise? This could be a great way to foster a culture of learning and collaboration within your team.
